question.text: Which of the following is correct about flowering in rice and wheat plants?

options.text: Rice needs a continuous uninterrupted long period of light to flower while wheat needs a continuous uninterrupted long period of darkness to flower
Wheat needs a continuous uninterrupted long period of light to flower while rice needs a continuous uninterrupted long period of darkness to flower
Both rice and wheat need a continuous uninterrupted long period of light to flower
Both rice and wheat need a continuous uninterrupted long period of darkness to flower

solution.text:
Wheat is a long day plant. These plants flowers only when they exposed to critical photoperiod or photoperiod longer than their critical day length. They need a continuous (uninterrupted) light period for flowering.

Rice is a short day or long night plant. These plants give flowers on exposure to photoperiod equal to or shorter than their critical day length. They need a continuous (uninterrupted) dark period for flowering.
